dialogues: Ebenezer: These particular files that I’ve found seem to support my claim.
Kaitlyn: You- went through my files!?
Ebenezer: I am willing to do whatever it takes to achieve my goal.
Kaitlyn: …
Ebenezer: These files indicate big budget cuts. Particularly in labor and security.
Ebenezer: Having a low number of employees and a dangerously low amount of security…
Ebenezer: That’s quite suspicious, don't you think?
Kaitlyn: That has a perfectly viable reason!
Ebenezer: Oh? I suppose the lack of security cameras means nothing in this case then…
Ebenezer: Or the lack of locks on the motel rooms…
Ebenezer: Or only having your own son working for you…
Kaitlyn: …Well-
Kaitlyn: You have to understand what those budget cuts were for!
Kaitlyn: They were made to fund a healthcare charity that I support!
Kaitlyn: After my husband died of tuberculosis, I had to do something!
Kaitlyn: No one batted an eye, not a single person…
Kaitlyn: Without my donations, the entire fund will fall!
Kaitlyn: Thousands will die, thousands will lose a loved one, just like how I lost him!
Kaitlyn: And my dear son… He will be all alone if I’m gone. He won't have me to support him anymore!
Ebenezer: Your son… Diego…
Ebenezer: Isn’t he quite close with your late guest, Martha, the victim of this case?
Ebenezer: You mentioned not liking her, saying she’s bad for business.
Ebenezer: You’d never let your son date… a whore.
Ebenezer: You did this to protect him, didn’t you? Or out of pure envy.
Ebenezer: Whatever your true reason may be.
Kaitlyn: !...
Kaitlyn: I didn’t murder her!
Kaitlyn: I may not approve of their relationship, but I’d never kill someone over something like that!
Kaitlyn: Get your head in the game! The actual murderer is still out there!
Ebenezer: Kaitlyn, you are the culprit.
Kaitlyn: …
Kaitlyn: You are making a HUGE mistake!
Kaitlyn: You will be the one behind the death of thousands, millions even!
Ebenezer: The evidence supports this claim enough.
Ebenezer: It’s over for you.
Kaitlyn: …
Kaitlyn: I hope you burn for the rest of your miserable life.
